items.standfirst: US President Trump and Ukrainian leader Zelenskyy are talking up prospects of ending the war with Russia.
items.content: US President Trump and Ukrainian leader Zelenskyy are talking up prospects of ending the war with Russia.

items.title: Trump says progress made in Ukraine talks but 'thorny issues' remain
items.standfirst: Both the US president and Zelensky describe talks in Florida as "great" and "terrific" but the issue of territory remains "unresolved".
items.content: Both the US president and Zelensky describe talks in Florida as "great" and "terrific" but the issue of territory remains "unresolved".

items.title: Ukraine war live: US has offered 15 years of security guarantees, says Zelenskyy
items.standfirst: Ukrainian leader had sought up to 50 years of security guarantees at Florida meeting with TrumpRussian troops have taken control of the village of Dibrova in Ukraine’s eastern Donetsk region, the defence ministry said this morning, in an update we have not yet been able to independently verify.The Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov also said that Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin will hold another phone call “very soon” after the two leaders spoke before the US president had his meeting with Zelenskyy in Florida yesterday. Continue reading...
items.content: Ukrainian leader had sought up to 50 years of security guarantees at Florida meeting with TrumpRussian troops have taken control of the village of Dibrova in Ukraine’s eastern Donetsk region, the defence ministry said this morning, in an update we have not yet been able to independently verify.The Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov also said that Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin will hold another phone call “very soon” after the two leaders spoke before the US president had his meeting with Zelenskyy in Florida yesterday. items.title: Ukraine talks: Peace plan '90% agreed' as Trump hosts Zelensky
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump hosted Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Florida to discuss a draft peace framework aimed at ending Russia’s war. Ukraine is seeking long-term US security guarantees, with Zelensky saying he has asked Trump for commitments lasting up to 50 years, beyond the 15 years currently envisaged.
items.content: US President Donald Trump hosted Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Florida to discuss a draft peace framework aimed at ending Russia’s war. Ukraine is seeking long-term US security guarantees, with Zelensky saying he has asked Trump for commitments lasting up to 50 years, beyond the 15 years currently envisaged.

items.standfirst: Ukraine's President Volodymr Zelenskyy said Monday that he has asked for up to 50 years' worth of security guarantees for Ukraine during his meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump at the weekend. Commenting on the talks with Trump in Florida on Sunday, Zelenskyy told journalists that he said a…

items.title: Thorny questions remain despite positive meeting reports from Trump and Zelensky
items.standfirst: US President Donald Turmp and Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky both reported progress on two of the most contentious issues regarding a peace deal in Ukraine: security guarantees for the country and the division of the eastern Donbas region, which Russia is trying to capture. But thorny questions remain. David Smith, Washington Bureau Chief for The Guardian, told us more.
items.content: US President Donald Turmp and Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky both reported progress on two of the most contentious issues regarding a peace deal in Ukraine: security guarantees for the country and the division of the eastern Donbas region, which Russia is trying to capture. But thorny questions remain. David Smith, Washington Bureau Chief for The Guardian, told us more.

items.title: Trump says ‘tough’ issues remain for Ukraine peace deal after meeting Zelenskyy in Florida
items.standfirst: US president said ‘thorny’ questions over territory have yet to be resolved and expressed sympathy with Russia not wanting a ceasefireDonald Trump has said a deal to end the war in Ukraine is “closer than ever” but has admitted that “thorny” questions over the future of the eastern Donbas region have yet to be resolved, after a two-hour meeting on Sunday with Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Florida.Trump said a draft agreement to end the war was nearly “95% done”. “I really think we are closer than ever with both sides,” he said, adding that the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, also wants to “see it happen”. Continue reading...
items.content: US president said ‘thorny’ questions over territory have yet to be resolved and expressed sympathy with Russia not wanting a ceasefireDonald Trump has said a deal to end the war in Ukraine is “closer than ever” but has admitted that “thorny” questions over the future of the eastern Donbas region have yet to be resolved, after a two-hour meeting on Sunday with Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Florida.Trump said a draft agreement to end the war was nearly “95% done”. “I really think we are closer than ever with both sides,” he said, adding that the Russian president, Vladimir Putin, also wants to “see it happen”. items.title: Live: Russia agrees with Trump that Ukraine talks are in their final stages
items.standfirst: The Kremlin on Monday said it agreed with US President Donald Trump that talks to end the Ukraine war were in their final stages. The news came after President Emmanuel Macron announced that allies of Kyiv would discuss security guarantees for Ukraine in Paris next month. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.
items.content: The Kremlin on Monday said it agreed with US President Donald Trump that talks to end the Ukraine war were in their final stages. The news came after President Emmanuel Macron announced that allies of Kyiv would discuss security guarantees for Ukraine in Paris next month. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.

items.title: Trump and Zelenskyy say they're nearly in agreement on Ukraine peace plan

items.content: President Trump met with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday after he said he had a "good and very productive" call with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

items.title: Trump meets with Zelenskyy, insists Putin is ready for peace
items.standfirst: President Trump spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin by phone before meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Florida on Sunday. Mr. Trump said he thinks both men are ready for peace. Willie James Inman reports.
items.content: President Trump spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin by phone before meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Florida on Sunday. Mr. Trump said he thinks both men are ready for peace. Willie James Inman reports.

items.title: Trump, Zelensky say Ukraine peace deal edging closer but key issues unresolved
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump said on Sunday that talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky were moving “very close” to an agreement to end the war in Ukraine, though both leaders acknowledged that major sticking points, including territory and security guarantees, remain unresolved.
items.content: US President Donald Trump said on Sunday that talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky were moving “very close” to an agreement to end the war in Ukraine, though both leaders acknowledged that major sticking points, including territory and security guarantees, remain unresolved.

items.content: During a press conference, President Donald Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said they are close to a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine.

items.content: President Donald Trump and his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy return to the negotiating room on Sunday with a familiar, fraught task: trying to chart a path toward ending Russia’s war against Ukraine.

items.title: China launches 2 days of live-fire military drills around Taiwan
items.standfirst: China launched live-fire drills around Taiwan that it said would simulate a blockade of the self-ruled island's key ports, prompting Taipei to condemn Beijing's "military intimidation."
items.content: China launched live-fire drills around Taiwan that it said would simulate a blockade of the self-ruled island's key ports, prompting Taipei to condemn Beijing's "military intimidation."

items.title: China Launches Major War Games Around Taiwan After US Arms Deal
items.standfirst: China on Monday announced large-scale military drills around Taiwan, mobilizing army, navy, air, and rocket forces in what Beijing called a “serious warning” to pro-independence forces and foreign backers, according to CNN. The exercises, named “Justice Mission-2025,” include live-fire drills and…

items.title: China holds military drills around Taiwan as warning to 'separatist forces'
items.standfirst: The drills come days after the US announced the sale of one of its largest weapons packages to Taiwan.
items.content: The drills come days after the US announced the sale of one of its largest weapons packages to Taiwan.

items.title: Chinese military stages drills around Taiwan to warn 'external forces'
items.standfirst: The drills came after Beijing expressed anger at U.S. arms sales, and a statement by Japan's prime minister saying its military could get involved if China were to take action against Taiwan.
items.content: The drills came after Beijing expressed anger at U.S. arms sales, and a statement by Japan's prime minister saying its military could get involved if China were to take action against Taiwan.(Image credit: Li Gang/AP)

items.title: China launches live-fire drills around Taiwan simulating blockade of major ports
items.standfirst: Taipei condemns exercise that Chinese army calls ‘a stern warning against “Taiwan independence” separatist forces and external interference forces’China has launched live-fire military drills around Taiwan, simulating a blockade of major ports, attacking maritime targets, and fending off international “interference”, in what it calls a warning to “separatist” forces in Taiwan.The People’s Liberation Army (PLA) – the military wing of the ruling Communist party in China – said it had sent naval, air force and rocket forces to surround Taiwan on Monday morning. Chinese coast guard vessels were also sent out to conduct “law enforcement inspections” at sea around Taiwan’s outer islands. Continue reading...
items.content: Taipei condemns exercise that Chinese army calls ‘a stern warning against “Taiwan independence” separatist forces and external interference forces’China has launched live-fire military drills around Taiwan, simulating a blockade of major ports, attacking maritime targets, and fending off international “interference”, in what it calls a warning to “separatist” forces in Taiwan.The People’s Liberation Army (PLA) – the military wing of the ruling Communist party in China – said it had sent naval, air force and rocket forces to surround Taiwan on Monday morning. Chinese coast guard vessels were also sent out to conduct “law enforcement inspections” at sea around Taiwan’s outer islands. Continue reading...

items.content: ‘Justice Mission 2025’ exercises to test US response after largest-ever arms sale to Taipei

items.title: China conducts large-scale Taiwan drills amid rising tensions
items.standfirst: China mobilised army, naval, air force and artillery units around Taiwan on Monday for its "Justice Mission 2025" exercises. Taipei responded by deploying troops to rehearse repelling a potential Chinese attack, underscoring the island's commitment to defending democracy amid escalating regional tensions.
items.content: China mobilised army, naval, air force and artillery units around Taiwan on Monday for its "Justice Mission 2025" exercises. Taipei responded by deploying troops to rehearse repelling a potential Chinese attack, underscoring the island's commitment to defending democracy amid escalating regional tensions.

items.title: Train accident in southern Mexico leaves at least 13 dead and dozens injured
items.standfirst: Officials said a train accident in southern Mexico killed at least 13 people and injured dozens, halting traffic along a rail line connecting the Pacific Ocean with the Gulf of Mexico.
items.content: Officials said a train accident in southern Mexico killed at least 13 people and injured dozens, halting traffic along a rail line connecting the Pacific Ocean with the Gulf of Mexico.

items.title: Mexico Train Crash Kills 13, Nearly 100 Injured
items.standfirst: A train in Mexico traveling between the states of Oaxaca and Veracruz derailed on Sunday, December 28, killing 13 people and injuring 98 people—five of them seriously—according to a statement issued by Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum on Monday. Why It Matters The tragic derailment comes at a…

items.title: At least 13 dead, 98 injured in southern Mexico train derailment
items.standfirst: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum confirmed that at least 13 people died in the Interoceanic Train derailment in southern Mexico. Officials stated that 241 passengers and nine crew members were on board when the train derailed near Nizanda.
items.content: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum confirmed that at least 13 people died in the Interoceanic Train derailment in southern Mexico. Officials stated that 241 passengers and nine crew members were on board when the train derailed near Nizanda.

items.title: Train derails in southern Mexico, killing 13 and injuring dozens
items.standfirst: Mexico's Navy says the train was carrying 250 people when it derailed partially near the town of Nizanda in Oaxaca.
items.content: Mexico's Navy says the train was carrying 250 people when it derailed partially near the town of Nizanda in Oaxaca.

items.title: Mexico train crash kills 13 and injures almost 100
items.standfirst: An investigation is under way after the train derailed as it rounded a bend near the town of Nizanda.
items.content: An investigation is under way after the train derailed as it rounded a bend near the town of Nizanda.

items.title: At least 13 people dead after train derails in Mexico
items.standfirst: At least 13 people have died and dozens more are being treated for their injuries after a train derailed in Mexico, authorities have said.
items.content: At least 13 people have died and dozens more are being treated for their injuries after a train derailed in Mexico, authorities have said.

clusters.title: Trump and Netanyahu to meet in Florida for crucial talks on Iran and Gaza
clusters.neutral_headline: Netanyahu to meet Trump in US amid fears of Israeli regional offensives

items.title: Trump and Netanyahu to meet in Florida for crucial talks on Iran and Gaza
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump will meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in Florida on Monday hoping to push forward the ceasefire that he brokered in Gaza, while the Israeli leader is expected to make the case for new action against Iran
items.content: President Donald Trump will meet with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in Florida on Monday hoping to push forward the ceasefire that he brokered in Gaza, while the Israeli leader is expected to make the case for new action against Iran

items.title: Winter rains flood camps, worsening living conditions for displaced Gazans
items.standfirst: Rain lashed the Gaza Strip, flooding makeshift encampments with ankle-deep puddles as Palestinians displaced by the two-year war attempted to stay dry in tents frayed by months of use. The flooding came as Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu travelled to Florida to discuss the second phase of the ceasefire agreement with US President Donald Trump.
items.content: Rain lashed the Gaza Strip, flooding makeshift encampments with ankle-deep puddles as Palestinians displaced by the two-year war attempted to stay dry in tents frayed by months of use. The flooding came as Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu travelled to Florida to discuss the second phase of the ceasefire agreement with US President Donald Trump.

items.title: Netanyahu and Trump to meet in Florida to discuss second phase of Gaza ceasefire
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and US President Donald Trump will meet in Florida on Monday to discuss the next stage of the fragile Gaza truce plan. Under the second phase of the ceasefire, Israel is due to withdraw from its positions in Gaza, while Hamas is supposed to lay down its weapons – a major sticking point in the discussions.
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and US President Donald Trump will meet in Florida on Monday to discuss the next stage of the fragile Gaza truce plan. Under the second phase of the ceasefire, Israel is due to withdraw from its positions in Gaza, while Hamas is supposed to lay down its weapons – a major sticking point in the discussions.

items.title: Trump and Netanyahu to meet in Florida at a crucial moment for the Gaza ceasefire
items.standfirst: President Trump could use the face-to-face at his Mar-a-Lago estate to look for ways to speed up the peace process, as Israel's leader has been accused of not pushing his side to move fast enough.
items.content: President Trump could use the face-to-face at his Mar-a-Lago estate to look for ways to speed up the peace process, as Israel's leader has been accused of not pushing his side to move fast enough.(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)

items.title: Netanyahu to meet Trump in US amid fears of Israeli regional offensives
items.standfirst: Israel’s PM travels to Mar-a-Lago as US administration reported to be running out of patience over Gaza ceasefireBenjamin Netanyahu is to meet Donald Trump at the US president’s Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida on Monday evening amid growing fears Israel could launch new offensives against regional enemies, potentially plunging the Middle East further into instability.The Israeli prime minister left Israel on Sunday on his fifth visit to see Trump in the US this year. Continue reading...
items.content: Israel’s PM travels to Mar-a-Lago as US administration reported to be running out of patience over Gaza ceasefireBenjamin Netanyahu is to meet Donald Trump at the US president’s Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida on Monday evening amid growing fears Israel could launch new offensives against regional enemies, potentially plunging the Middle East further into instability.The Israeli prime minister left Israel on Sunday on his fifth visit to see Trump in the US this year. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump to press Netanyahu on stalled Gaza ceasefire, Iran and Lebanon
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump is expected to push for progress on the faltering Gaza ceasefire when he meets Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday, with talks also set to cover Israel’s security concerns over Hezbollah in Lebanon and Iran.
items.content: US President Donald Trump is expected to push for progress on the faltering Gaza ceasefire when he meets Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday, with talks also set to cover Israel’s security concerns over Hezbollah in Lebanon and Iran.

items.title: Man shot dead by police after two-vehicle collision in Thetford
items.standfirst: Norfolk police say man believed to be driver of one of the vehicles shot by armed officers after leaving scene holding a handgunA man believed to be carrying a handgun has been shot and killed by police after a two-vehicle collision in Thetford, Norfolk police said.Officers were called to London Road at about 8.25pm on Sunday after receiving reports of a two-vehicle collision. Police said one man, believed to be the driver of one of the vehicles, left the scene holding what was described as a handgun. Continue reading...
items.content: Norfolk police say man believed to be driver of one of the vehicles shot by armed officers after leaving scene holding a handgunA man believed to be carrying a handgun has been shot and killed by police after a two-vehicle collision in Thetford, Norfolk police said.Officers were called to London Road at about 8.25pm on Sunday after receiving reports of a two-vehicle collision. Police said one man, believed to be the driver of one of the vehicles, left the scene holding what was described as a handgun. Continue reading...

items.title: U.S. slashes pledge for U.N. humanitarian aid funding to $2 billion
items.standfirst: The U.S. announced a $2 billion pledge for U.N. humanitarian aid as President Trump's administration continues to slash U.S. foreign assistance and warns United Nations agencies to "adapt, shrink or die" in a time of new financial realities.
items.content: The U.S. announced a $2 billion pledge for U.N. humanitarian aid as President Trump's administration continues to slash U.S. foreign assistance and warns United Nations agencies to "adapt, shrink or die" in a time of new financial realities.

items.title: 'Adapt, shrink or die’: US ties €1.7bn UN aid pledge to sweeping reforms
items.standfirst: The US is offering €1.7 billion in humanitarian funding — far less than in previous years — while demanding a radical overhaul of how the UN delivers aid worldwide.
items.content: The US is offering €1.7 billion in humanitarian funding — far less than in previous years — while demanding a radical overhaul of how the UN delivers aid worldwide.

In Germany, it threatens the future of the coalition government. In Spain,…
items.content: Ageing populations and falling birthrates have left ever fewer workers to support growing number of retirees It has played a starring role in one of the worst periods of political turmoil in France since the 1960s. items.title: Pensions timebomb: why Europe’s social contract is becoming unsustainable
items.standfirst: Ageing populations and falling birthrates have left ever fewer workers to support growing number of retireesIt has played a starring role in one of the worst periods of political turmoil in France since the 1960s. In Germany, it threatens the future of the coalition government. In Spain, thousands have taken to the streets to demand change.The right to a decent state pension has been a central plank of the European social contract for decades, but people are living longer, birthrates are falling, and the continent’s pension systems are, increasingly, unsustainable. Continue reading...
items.content: Ageing populations and falling birthrates have left ever fewer workers to support growing number of retireesIt has played a starring role in one of the worst periods of political turmoil in France since the 1960s. In Germany, it threatens the future of the coalition government. In Spain, thousands have taken to the streets to demand change.The right to a decent state pension has been a central plank of the European social contract for decades, but people are living longer, birthrates are falling, and the continent’s pension systems are, increasingly, unsustainable. Continue reading...

clusters.title: E-commerce giant Coupang offers €1 billion compensation scheme after massive data breach
clusters.neutral_headline: Coupang Offers $1 Billion Compensation for Data Breach Victims

items.title: E-commerce giant Coupang offers €1 billion compensation scheme after massive data breach
items.standfirst: Over a month after announcing a massive data breach affecting 34 million of its users, South Korean e-commerce company Coupang announced this Monday it would offer 1.69 trillion won in compensation (around €1 billion) to customers in the form of vouchers. Also in this edition, former EU digital chief Thierry Breton gives his first interview since being sanctioned by the US. Plus, Nokia's archived mobile design plans are now open to the public.
items.content: Over a month after announcing a massive data breach affecting 34 million of its users, South Korean e-commerce company Coupang announced this Monday it would offer 1.69 trillion won in compensation (around €1 billion) to customers in the form of vouchers. Also in this edition, former EU digital chief Thierry Breton gives his first interview since being sanctioned by the US. Plus, Nokia's archived mobile design plans are now open to the public.

items.title: Coupang Offers $1 Billion Compensation for Data Breach Victims
items.standfirst: Coupang is offering compensation worth more than $1 billion to all customers affected by South Korea’s biggest-ever data breach.
items.content: Coupang is offering compensation worth more than $1 billion to all customers affected by South Korea’s biggest-ever data breach.

clusters.title: DigitalBridge shares jump 50% after report SoftBank is in talks to acquire firm
clusters.neutral_headline: DigitalBridge shares jump 50% after report SoftBank is in talks to acquire firm

items.title: DigitalBridge shares jump 50% after report SoftBank is in talks to acquire firm
items.standfirst: Shares of data center investment firm DigitalBridge surged as much as 50% in premarket trade on Monday, following a media report that Japan's SoftBank is in advanced talks to acquire the New York-listed company. SoftBank could announce a deal as soon as Monday, Bloomberg reported, citing unnamed…
items.content: Shares of data center investment firm DigitalBridge surged as much as 50% in premarket trade on Monday, following a media report that Japan's SoftBank is in advanced talks to acquire the New York-listed company. SoftBank could announce a deal as soon as Monday, Bloomberg reported, citing unnamed…

items.title: DigitalBridge soars 42% on buyout rumors
items.standfirst: The shares of DigitalBridge Group Inc rallied in the premarket on Monday, jumping around 42%, following potential acquisition reports.The company's stock surged 42.03% at 4:31 am ET, going for $19.85 ...
items.content: The shares of DigitalBridge Group Inc rallied in the premarket on Monday, jumping around 42%, following potential acquisition reports.The company's stock surged 42.03% at 4:31 am ET, going for $19.85 ...

items.title: Sources: SoftBank is in advanced talks to buy NYSE-listed DigitalBridge, a private equity firm that invests in data centers and digital infrastructure operators
SoftBank Nears Deal for Data Center Investment Firm DigitalBridge
items.standfirst: SoftBank Group Corp. is in advanced talks to acquire DigitalBridge Group Inc., a private equity firm that invests in assets such as data centers, according to people with knowledge of the matter.
items.content: SoftBank Group Corp. is in advanced talks to acquire DigitalBridge Group Inc., a private equity firm that invests in assets such as data centers, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

items.title: Electric vehicles had a bumpy road in 2025 — and one pleasant surprise
items.standfirst: A suite of pro-EV federal policies have been reversed. Well-known vehicles have been discontinued. Sales plummeted. But interest is holding steady.

clusters.title: Trump Admin, FBI Tighten Screw Amid New Minnesota Fraud Allegations
clusters.neutral_headline: FBI deploys more resources to ‘dismantle fraud schemes’ in Minnesota

items.title: Trump Admin, FBI Tighten Screw Amid New Minnesota Fraud Allegations
items.standfirst: The FBI has deployed personnel and resources to Minnesota to “dismantle large-scale fraud schemes exploiting federal programs,” FBI Director Kash Patel said on Sunday. Patel’s comments come after a video from independent journalist Nick Shirley that documented visits to multiple day care centers…
items.content: The FBI has deployed personnel and resources to Minnesota to “dismantle large-scale fraud schemes exploiting federal programs,” FBI Director Kash Patel said on Sunday. Patel’s comments come after a video from independent journalist Nick Shirley that documented visits to multiple day care centers…

items.title: FBI deploys more resources to ‘dismantle fraud schemes’ in Minnesota
items.standfirst: Kash Patel claims $250m scheme that stole Covid aid is ‘tip of iceberg’ and alleges state’s Somalia population is to blameThe FBI has deployed additional personnel and investigative resources to Minnesota to “dismantle large-scale fraud schemes exploiting federal programs”, director Kash Patel said on social media on Sunday.The FBI director said the agency had already dismantled a $250m fraud scheme that stole federal food aid meant for vulnerable children during the Covid pandemic in a case that led to 78 indictments and 57 convictions. Continue reading...
items.content: Kash Patel claims $250m scheme that stole Covid aid is ‘tip of iceberg’ and alleges state’s Somalia population is to blameThe FBI has deployed additional personnel and investigative resources to Minnesota to “dismantle large-scale fraud schemes exploiting federal programs”, director Kash Patel said on social media on Sunday.The FBI director said the agency had already dismantled a $250m fraud scheme that stole federal food aid meant for vulnerable children during the Covid pandemic in a case that led to 78 indictments and 57 convictions. Continue reading...

items.title: UK accounting body to halt remote exams amid AI cheating
items.standfirst: Candidates will have to sit assessments in person unless there are exceptional circumstances, says ACCA Business live – latest updates The world’s largest accounting body is to stop students being allowed to take exams remotely to crack down on a rise in cheating on tests that underpin…
items.content: Candidates will have to sit assessments in person unless there are exceptional circumstances, says ACCA Business live – latest updates The world’s largest accounting body is to stop students being allowed to take exams remotely to crack down on a rise in cheating on tests that underpin…

items.title: UK accounting body to halt remote exams amid AI cheating
items.standfirst: Candidates will have to sit assessments in person unless there are exceptional circumstances, says ACCABusiness live – latest updatesThe world’s largest accounting body is to stop students being allowed to take exams remotely to crack down on a rise in cheating on tests that underpin professional qualifications.The Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA), which has almost 260,000 members, has said that from March it will stop allowing students to take online exams in all but exceptional circumstances. Continue reading...
items.content: Candidates will have to sit assessments in person unless there are exceptional circumstances, says ACCABusiness live – latest updatesThe world’s largest accounting body is to stop students being allowed to take exams remotely to crack down on a rise in cheating on tests that underpin professional qualifications.The Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA), which has almost 260,000 members, has said that from March it will stop allowing students to take online exams in all but exceptional circumstances. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Myanmar's pro-military party 'winning a majority' in junta-run poll, official says
clusters.neutral_headline: Polls close in first phase of Myanmar elections widely condemned as a sham

items.title: Myanmar's pro-military party 'winning a majority' in junta-run poll, official says
items.standfirst: Myanmar's dominant pro-military party is "winning a majority" in the first phase of junta-run elections, a party source said on Monday, after democracy watchdogs warned the poll would entrench military rule. The vote has been widely condemned for its stark crackdown on dissent and a candidate list stacked with military allies.
items.content: Myanmar's dominant pro-military party is "winning a majority" in the first phase of junta-run elections, a party source said on Monday, after democracy watchdogs warned the poll would entrench military rule. The vote has been widely condemned for its stark crackdown on dissent and a candidate list stacked with military allies.

items.title: Polls close in first phase of Myanmar elections widely condemned as a sham
items.standfirst: Turnout appears low for vote in which most candidates seen as allies of junta and large areas excluded by warPolls have closed in conflict-racked Myanmar, ending the first phase of an election that has been widely condemned as a sham designed to legitimise the military junta’s rule.The military has touted the vote as a return to democracy almost five years after it seized power in a coup, ousting the country’s then de-facto leader, Aung San Suu Kyi, detaining her and sparking a spiralling civil war. Continue reading...
items.content: Turnout appears low for vote in which most candidates seen as allies of junta and large areas excluded by warPolls have closed in conflict-racked Myanmar, ending the first phase of an election that has been widely condemned as a sham designed to legitimise the military junta’s rule.The military has touted the vote as a return to democracy almost five years after it seized power in a coup, ousting the country’s then de-facto leader, Aung San Suu Kyi, detaining her and sparking a spiralling civil war. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 expected to resume on Tuesday
clusters.neutral_headline: Search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 expected to resume on Tuesday

items.title: Search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 expected to resume on Tuesday
items.standfirst: Marine robotics firm to renew its search more than decade after plane disappeared with 239 people onboardThe search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 is expected to resume on 30 December, more than a decade after the plane disappeared with 239 people onboard in one of aviation’s greatest mysteries.A renewed search by Ocean Infinity, a UK and US-based marine robotics company, had begun earlier this year but was called off in April because of bad weather. Continue reading...
items.content: Marine robotics firm to renew its search more than decade after plane disappeared with 239 people onboardThe search for Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 is expected to resume on 30 December, more than a decade after the plane disappeared with 239 people onboard in one of aviation’s greatest mysteries.A renewed search by Ocean Infinity, a UK and US-based marine robotics company, had begun earlier this year but was called off in April because of bad weather. Continue reading...

items.title: Hunt for missing flight MH370 to resume more than a decade after disappearance
items.standfirst: An American company will conduct another search for missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, more than a decade after its disappearance en route to Beijing from Kuala Lumpur. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer has the details.
items.content: An American company will conduct another search for missing Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, more than a decade after its disappearance en route to Beijing from Kuala Lumpur. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer has the details.

clusters.title: Kim oversees cruise missile launch as North Korea touts nuclear readiness
clusters.neutral_headline: North Korea’s Kim oversees test launch of long-range cruise missiles

items.title: Kim oversees cruise missile launch as North Korea touts nuclear readiness
items.standfirst: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un oversaw the launch of long-range strategic cruise missiles on Sunday, state media said, as Pyongyang stepped up military activity it says is aimed at reinforcing its nuclear deterrent amid what it calls growing security threats.
items.content: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un oversaw the launch of long-range strategic cruise missiles on Sunday, state media said, as Pyongyang stepped up military activity it says is aimed at reinforcing its nuclear deterrent amid what it calls growing security threats.

items.title: North Korea’s Kim oversees test launch of long-range cruise missiles
items.standfirst: Kim urges 'unlimited and sustained' development of nuclear combat forces as North Korea gears up for key party congress.
items.content: Kim urges 'unlimited and sustained' development of nuclear combat forces as North Korea gears up for key party congress.

clusters.title: Passengers on cruise ship that ran aground off PNG to be flown home after refloat efforts fail
clusters.neutral_headline: Cruise ship hits reef on first trip since leaving passenger on island

items.title: Passengers on cruise ship that ran aground off PNG to be flown home after refloat efforts fail
items.standfirst: Coral Adventurer, being investigated for allegedly leaving behind passenger who died, ran aground with 124 people on board on SaturdayGet our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastAn Australian cruise ship remains stuck on a reef off Papua New Guinea despite efforts to free it, with passengers set to be flown home early.The Coral Adventurer, which ran aground on Saturday morning, was already under investigation as a result of an unrelated incident in October, in which a passenger died after being allegedly left behind on an island. It was on its first voyage since the passenger’s death when it ran aground. Continue reading...
items.content: Coral Adventurer, being investigated for allegedly leaving behind passenger who died, ran aground with 124 people on board on SaturdayGet our breaking news email, free app or daily news podcastAn Australian cruise ship remains stuck on a reef off Papua New Guinea despite efforts to free it, with passengers set to be flown home early.The Coral Adventurer, which ran aground on Saturday morning, was already under investigation as a result of an unrelated incident in October, in which a passenger died after being allegedly left behind on an island. It was on its first voyage since the passenger’s death when it ran aground. Continue reading...

items.title: Cruise ship hits reef on first trip since leaving passenger on island
items.standfirst: The Coral Adventurer is under investigation for the death of Suzanne Rees, who was found dead on a remote island after being left behind by the ship.
items.content: The Coral Adventurer is under investigation for the death of Suzanne Rees, who was found dead on a remote island after being left behind by the ship.

items.title: Kosovo's ruling party wins election after months of political deadlock
items.standfirst: The decisive victory for the Albanian nationalist Vetevendosje party means a third term for leader Albin Kurti.
items.content: The decisive victory for the Albanian nationalist Vetevendosje party means a third term for leader Albin Kurti.

items.title: Kosovo's Prime Minister Kurti set for second term after decisive election win
items.standfirst: Kosovo’s Prime Minister Albin Kurti looked poised to secure another term on Sunday after his Self-Determination party won a snap parliamentary election by a wide margin, preliminary results showed, ending months of political deadlock in the Balkan country.
items.content: Kosovo’s Prime Minister Albin Kurti looked poised to secure another term on Sunday after his Self-Determination party won a snap parliamentary election by a wide margin, preliminary results showed, ending months of political deadlock in the Balkan country.

items.standfirst: The report said that a Russian rocket sent the satellites on Sunday from a launchpad in eastern Russia.
items.content: The report said that a Russian rocket sent the satellites on Sunday from a launchpad in eastern Russia.(Image credit: Ivan Timoshenko)

items.title: Iran Says It Launched Three Satellites Into Space From Russia
items.standfirst: Iran said it sent three satellites into orbit from Russia on Sunday, a move that may intensify tensions over Tehran’s broader actions.
items.content: Iran said it sent three satellites into orbit from Russia on Sunday, a move that may intensify tensions over Tehran’s broader actions.
